pageContext.description:
This painting represents an episode from the Bible: as Christ utters His final words ('Father, into Thy hands I commend my spirit'), a Roman centurion experiences a religious conversion, recognizing that 'Truly this man was the Son of God'. Both phrases are inscribed here in German, rather than in the traditional Latin. 
The coat of arms, however, has not been positively identified.

[http://artgallery.yale.edu/collections/objects/43516] (accessed 2016-07-07)

Dimensions of support: 61.6 x 42.4 cm

[http://artgallery.yale.edu/collections/objects/43516] (accessed 2016-07-07)
pageContext.inscription:
- above the cross:
'VATER IN DEIN HENDT BEFIEL ICH MEIN GAIST' 
- beside the centurion:
'WARLICH DIESER MENSCH IST GOTTES SVN GEWEST'
